listWit.witness: The girl who wanted to fly

projectDesc.p: "La pucele qui vouloit voler" is part of The Global Medieval Sourcebook, a digital compendium of medieval texts in their original languages and in English translation. This larger project comprises computer-readable transcriptions and/or editions of texts dating from the ninth to the sixteenth century, and originating in Europe, North Africa, the Middle East, and Asia; accompanied by new English translations; high-resolution digital images of manuscript/early print sources, where available; an apparatus that includes critical introductions, textual notes and annotations; and a flexible user interface with which to navigate these materials.

editorialDecl.p: Transcriptions and translations are encoded in XML conforming to TEI (P5) guidelines. The original-language text is contained within <lem> tags and translations within <rdg> tags.
editorialDecl.interpretation: Texts are translated into modern English with maximum fidelity to the original text, except where it would impair comprehension or good style. Archaisms are preserved where they do not conflict with the aesthetic of the original text. Creative translation choices are marked and discussed in the critical notes.

app.rdg: About a lady I want
To tell you, eyes have never seen
One as beloved as she,

app.lem: Et de biauté grant los avoit.
app.rdg: And she had great beauty.
By rich clerics, by knights,
And by bourgeois and squires
She was beseeched at all hours,

app.lem: Mes ne voloit en nule guise
app.rdg: But she did not in any way
Want to hear their prayers.

app.lem: Un jor dit qu'el voudroit voler.
app.rdg: One day she said that she would like to fly.
You know, several people heard her:
They were marvelously shocked by it.
They courted her with

app.lem: De cire et de pennes d'oisel;
app.rdg: Wax and bird feathers;

app.lem: As braz et as costez li mistrent,
app.rdg: They put it on her sides and arms,
And, you know, they greatly concerned themselves
To adjust it carefully:

app.lem: Mais ainz por ce ne pot voler.
app.rdg: But for all that she could not fly.

app.lem: Uns clers li dist: "Ce ne valt rien,
app.rdg: A cleric said to her: "This won't work,
Lady, you know it well!
It will serve you better to dress
Differently if you want to fly:
You need to have a beak

app.lem: Et queue, ce sachiez de voir,
app.rdg: And a tail, you know in truth,

app.lem: Que nus oisaus sans ce ne vole.
app.rdg: That no birds fly without these.
-- I agree with what you say,

app.lem: Fait la pucele, et je l'otroi.
app.rdg: Said the girl, and I agree to it.

app.lem: Qui fera ce? Dites lou moi!
app.rdg: Who will do it? Tell me!
-- Lady, he said, I will!
If you ask, even today

app.lem: Vos cuit je fere plus bel bec
app.rdg: I will make you the most beautiful beak

app.lem: Et miaus fet que n'a nul espec;
app.rdg: And better than any woodpecker's;
A more beautiful tail I will make you

app.lem: Que poons, que ja n'i faudrai!"
app.rdg: Than a peacock, I will not fail!"

app.lem: A tant en une chanbre entrerent
app.rdg: So they went into a room

app.lem: En l'uis sor aus mout bien fermerent.
app.rdg: And shut the door firmly behind them.

app.lem: Li clers en un lit la cocha:
app.rdg: The cleric threw her on a bed:

app.lem: Plus de trente fois la besa.
app.rdg: And kissed her more than thirty times.
She asked what this was;

app.lem: Il dit que lou bec li faisoit.
app.rdg: He said that he was making her a beak.

app.lem: "Fet lo l'en donc en tel maniere?
app.rdg: "So, you make one like this?
-- Yes, turn your bottom around
So I can place the tail.
-- Sir cleric, she said, I will do
Everything you teach me,

app.lem: Mes gardez que vos n'i failloiz!"
app.rdg: But be careful you don't mess up there!"
She then got on her hands and knees.
He beat his cock in her cunt

app.lem: Lo vit el con, sanz contredit.
app.rdg: Up to his balls, without objection.
And the lady spoke to him
And asked what he was doing:

app.lem: Il dit que sa coe li fet.
app.rdg: He said he was making her tail.
"Sir cleric, she said, hurry up now!
Push it in deep, and attach it
So strongly that it won't get shat out.
I will be so adorned
When I leave you

app.lem: Bien cuit que je voler porrai."
app.rdg: I know well that I will be able to fly."

app.lem: Et li clers bote adés en l'angle,
app.rdg: And the cleric continued to push it all the way in,

app.lem: Cui il n'est gaires de sa jangle.
app.rdg: He was not far from his orgasm.

app.lem: Quant ot de li fet son talant,
app.rdg: When he had from her what he wanted,
He sat down on the bed
With the lady next to him.

app.lem: "Danz clers, fet ele, don n'iert hui
app.rdg: "Sir cleric, she said, won't it be today
That this tail is complete?

app.lem: Fetes la tost, que mout me hete!"
app.rdg: Do it all, I'm in a big hurry!"

app.lem: La boche li bese et la face,
app.rdg: She kissed his mouth and face,

app.lem: Et si li prie que il face
app.rdg: And so beseeched him to make

app.lem: La qeue tost, se Dieus l'i salt.
app.rdg: All the tail, God willing.

app.lem: "Do bec, fet ele, ne me chalt:
app.rdg: "The beak, she said, doesn't matter to me:

app.lem: Ce puet assez metre en respit!"
app.rdg: That you can put aside!"

app.lem: De la queue li prie et dit
app.rdg: About the tail she begged him and said

app.lem: Que il la face sanz demore.
app.rdg: The he should make it without delay.

app.lem: Li clers dist: "Se Dieus me secore,
app.rdg: The cleric said: "May God save me,

app.lem: El n'iert fete devant un an.
app.rdg: It won't be done before a year.

app.lem: —- Dan clers, fet el, par saint Jehan,
app.rdg: -- Sir cleric, she said, by Saint John,
Never leave me
Until you've completed it!"
He stayed with the lady,

app.lem: Car la parole li fu bele,
app.rdg: Because her words were beautiful to him,
And occupied himself with the tail:

app.lem: Chascun jor un petit en fist.
app.rdg: Each day he made a little bit of it.

app.lem: Tant l'empainst et tant i hurta
app.rdg: He thrust and banged there so much
That the lady got pregnant.
"Alas, she said, cleric, you mocked me!

app.lem: La queue mést el cors germee:
app.rdg: The tail germinated in my body:

app.lem: Je cuit que je soie engroissiee.
app.rdg: I think I might be pregnant.
So cruelly you tricked me:
I can barely walk!
How will I be able to fly?
I am much worse off:
You really know how to trick people!"

app.lem: Li clers li dist: "Par saint Amant,
app.rdg: The cleric said to her: "By Saint Love,

app.lem: Vos m'alez a grant tort blasmant,
app.rdg: You wrongly blame me,

app.lem: Que, par la foi que je vos doi,
app.rdg: Because, by the fait I owe you,
You were to too trusting of me!

app.lem: Se grosse iestes, ce est nature,
app.rdg: If you are pregnant, that is nature,
But it was very unnatural
To want to fly through the air:

app.lem: Trop par en faites a blasmer,
app.rdg: You spend too much time making blame,
For the little that weighs you down."
In this way he served her
As you can now hear.

app.lem: Et ce l'en doit bien avenir:
app.rdg: And this is the outcome that should arise:

app.lem: Qui otrage quiert il li vient!
app.rdg: Who seeks a wish will get it!

app.lem: Por ce de ceste me sovient
app.rdg: For this reason I will remember this girl
Who was too unreasonable:

app.lem: Issi li fu la qeue entee.
app.rdg: And thus had her tail put in.
